last_episode_to_air.name: Quo Vadimus
last_episode_to_air.overview: Rebecca returns, Natalie and Jeremy rekindle their relationship, and the network is sold.

name: Sports Night
overview: The offbeat cast and crew of a sports news show deal with professional, personal, and ethical challenges while functioning in a pressure-cooker work environment.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: Dejected by his divorce and the state of sports, Casey contemplates leaving "Sports Night". Natalie has a crush on an applicant for an associate producer position.

episodes.name: The Apology
episodes.overview: The network is upset when a newly-published magazine interview reveals that Dan is in favor of the legalization of marijuana.

episodes.name: The Hungry and the Hunted
episodes.overview: Jeremy gets his first big producing break - a hunting segment. Natalie tries to get Casey interested in Dana during the run-up to one of Luther Sach's dinner parties.

episodes.name: Intellectual Property
episodes.overview: Casey's jealousy over Dana and Gordon leaves him kicking fire hydrants and hearing phantom flies. Dan faces repercussions from the network for his birthday present to Casey.

episodes.name: Mary Pat Shelby
episodes.overview: Natalie does a pre-interview with a volatile football player and things get out of hand.

episodes.name: The Head Coach, Dinner and the Morning Mail
episodes.overview: A distracted Natalie keeps forgetting things, while Jeremy tries to shield her from her hate mail.

episodes.name: Dear Louise
episodes.overview: Jeremy writes a letter to his sister Louise, flashing back over the day's events, including Dan's problems with writer's block and Isaac's problems with his daughter's new boyfriend.

episodes.name: Thespis
episodes.overview: Dana worries about her Thanksgiving turkey, Isaac worries about his pregnant daughter, and the ghost of Thespis wreaks havoc on the set.

episodes.name: The Quality of Mercy at 29K
episodes.overview: The team anchors a broadcast from Mt. Everest, Dana sees a Broadway show, and Dan tries to find a worthy charity.

episodes.name: Shoe Money Tonight
episodes.overview: Dan and Casey are Atlantic City-bound after the broadcast, Natalie and Jeremy have a fight, and Isaac discovers he's shrinking.

episodes.name: The Six Southern Gentlemen of Tennessee
episodes.overview: Casey appears on _"View, The" (1997)_ and the team follows the story of seven college football players who are suspended for refusing to play under the Confederate flag.

episodes.name: Smoky
episodes.overview: Dan decides that it's time Casey started dating again, so long as he stays away from Sally Sasser. Isaac fears for his job.

episodes.name: Small Town
episodes.overview: Dana, Gordon, Casey, and a woman from Gordon's office go on a double-date, leaving Natalie to produce the show and Dan to contend with a replacement anchor.

episodes.name: Rebecca
episodes.overview: Dan obsesses over a woman who works in the building, and everyone worries about Isaac's job.

episodes.name: Dana and the Deep Blue Sea
episodes.overview: Gordon invites Dana to go snorkeling, and Dan begs Jeremy to talk him up to Rebecca.

episodes.name: Sally
episodes.overview: Gordon stands Dana up, and Casey's missing his favorite shirt.

episodes.name: How Are Things in Glocca Morra?
episodes.overview: The show is held up when a tennis match goes longer than expected, putting a damper on Dana and Gordon's dinner plans.

episodes.name: The Sword of Orion
episodes.overview: Jeremy's parents are getting divorced, and Dan eagerly awaits Orlando Rojas' return to baseball.

episodes.name: Eli's Coming
episodes.overview: Isaac is late coming back from vacation, Bobbi Bernstein returns, and Steve Sisco visits Rebecca.

episodes.name: Ordnance Tactics
episodes.overview: A bomb scare clears the building, Jeremy tries to break up with Natalie, and the network starts pressuring Dana.

episodes.name: Ten Wickets
episodes.overview: Casey is still rattled from the bomb scare, Jeremy tries to understand a cricket story, and Rebecca makes her decision about Dan.

episodes.name: Napoleon's Battle Plan
episodes.overview: When Dana and Gordon get engaged, Casey has no plan and Dan's compelled to reveal a secret.

episodes.name: What Kind of Day Has It Been
episodes.overview: Casey's son comes to visit, and Dana takes a group photo with her new camera. Season One Finale.

episodes.name: Special Powers
episodes.overview: Casey tries to find the courage to ask Dana out, Isaac's back at work, and Jeremy and Natalie have a fight.

episodes.name: When Something Wicked This Way Comes
episodes.overview: Dana goes to a bachelorette party and has an epiphany, Dan has breakfast with Hillary Clinton, and Isaac brings in a ratings guy.

episodes.name: Cliff Gardner
episodes.overview: The staff are stressed out by Sam Donovan's presence, and things get worse when J.J. stops by to give them notes.

episodes.name: Louise Revisited
episodes.overview: Casey does everything he can to win the Sports Night Who's Cooler: Dan or Casey? internet poll. Dana has dinner with an old school friend.

episodes.name: Kafelnikov
episodes.overview: Jeremy readies the show's computer systems for Y2K. Dan meets a woman in a bar, discovering later that she's a psychologist.

episodes.name: Shane
episodes.overview: Casey wants to edit an interview to cast a ballplayer in a more favorable light, Dan has trouble taping a teaser, and The Vatican declares there's no such place as Hell.

episodes.name: Kyle Whitaker's Got Two Sacks
episodes.overview: Jeremy has to fire an intern, and the team covers breaking news of a football steroid scandal.

episodes.name: The Reunion
episodes.overview: Dana's brother comes to visit. Natalie asks Dan to review her audition tape.

episodes.name: A Girl Named Pixley
episodes.overview: It's a very slow news day, Casey goes on a date with a woman named Pixley, and Jeremy is up for an award.

episodes.name: The Giants Win the Pennant, the Giants Win the Pennant
episodes.overview: Dana begins to see the flaw in her dating plan. Dan wants to use Isaac in a feature on the 1951 New York Giants pennant win.

episodes.name: The Cut Man Cometh
episodes.overview: Dan and Casey cover a boxing match. Dan's father visits.

episodes.name: The Sweet Smell of Air
episodes.overview: The show lands an interview with Michael Jordan but there are a few strings attached. Sam returns.

episodes.name: Dana Get Your Gun
episodes.overview: Dan tries to get the night off for a Tom Waits concert. Dana inherits a gun.

episodes.name: And the Crowd Goes Wild
episodes.overview: It's Sam's last day at the show, Jeremy and Natalie break up, and Casey gets his eyes examined.

episodes.name: Celebrities
episodes.overview: Natalie organizes a post-show trivia game but excludes Jeremy, who ends up meeting a woman at a bar.

episodes.name: The Local Weather
episodes.overview: Dan reacts to not making the 100 Most Influential People in Sports list. Dana goes to church.

episodes.name: Draft Day: Part I - It Can't Rain at Indian Wells
episodes.overview: The team covers the first round of the NFL draft. Jeremy is nervous about Jenny's visit to the studio.

episodes.name: Draft Day: Part II - The Fall of Ryan O'Brian
episodes.overview: It's the second round of the NFL draft. Jenny visits, and Dan and Casey fight.

episodes.name: April is the Cruelest Month
episodes.overview: The network's cutting costs and jobs may be on the line. The staff sit for Passover Seder, and Dan hopes this will afford him the chance to mend a few fences.

episodes.name: Bells and a Siren
episodes.overview: Natalie has a job interview with Saturday Night Live. Dan hires a publicist.

episodes.name: La Forza Del Destino
episodes.overview: Dana meets a man with inside information on the sale of the network. Dan and Casey have a job offer in Los Angeles.

episodes.name: Quo Vadimus
episodes.overview: Rebecca returns, Natalie and Jeremy rekindle their relationship, and the network is sold.
